intro: Ardisia kusukusensis, commonly known as the Kusukus Island ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the island of Kusukus in the Solomon Islands and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, glossy leaves. The plant produces clusters of white flowers followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
